Welcome to fastapi_app’s documentation!¶

fastapi_app main¶

main.read_root()¶

The function displays welcome message.

Returns:

The text ‘Hello World’

async main.startup()¶

The function creates a connection to the Redis server and initializes the FastAPI query limiter.

fastapi_app src conf Config¶

class src.conf.config.Settings(_env_file: str | PathLike | List[str | PathLike] | Tuple[str | PathLike, ...] | None = '<object object>', _env_file_encoding: str | None = None, _env_nested_delimiter: str | None = None, _secrets_dir: str | PathLike | None = None, *, sqlalchemy_database_url: str = 'postgresql+psycopg2://postgres:098765@localhost:5432/postgres', secret_key: str = 'secret_key', algorithm: str = 'HS256', mail_username: str = 'django@i-ups.pl', mail_password: str = 'Asdqwe123!', mail_from: str = 'django@i-ups.pl', mail_port: str = '465', mail_server: str = 's38.cyber-folks.pl', redis_host: str = 'localhost', redis_port: str = '6379', redis_password: str = None, cloudinary_name: str = '', cloudinary_api_key: str = '', cloudinary_api_secret: str = '')¶

Bases: BaseSettings

Configuration settings for the application, loaded from environment variables.

Attributes:

sqlalchemy_database_url (str): The database connection URL. secret_key (str): The secret key for JWT token generation. algorithm (str): The algorithm used for JWT token encoding. Defaults to “HS256”. mail_username (str): The username for the mail server. mail_password (str): The password for the mail server. mail_from (str): The email address to use for sending emails. mail_port (str): The port to use for the mail server. mail_server (str): The address of the mail server. redis_host (str): The host address for the Redis server. redis_port (str): The port for the Redis server. redis_password (str, optional): The password for the Redis server, if any. cloudinary_name (str): The Cloudinary cloud name. cloudinary_api_key (str): The Cloudinary API key. cloudinary_api_secret (str): The Cloudinary API secret.

Config:

env_file (str): The name of the file to load environment variables from. env_file_encoding (str): The encoding of the environment file.

fastapi_app src database Db¶

src.database.db.get_db()¶

Provides a database session to be used in a dependency injection context.

This function is intended to be used with FastAPI’s dependency injection system. It yields a SQLAlchemy session that is automatically closed after the request is finished.

Yield:

A SQLAlchemy database session.

Return type:

sqlalchemy.orm.Session

class src.database.models.Comment(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Class which describes table in database of the Comment

Parameters:

  • id (int) – comment’s unique id in DB

  • photo_id (int) – the id number of the photo to which the tag is to be assigned

  • user_id (int) – Id number of the user who entered the note into the DB

  • content (str) – comment of the photo

  • created_at (datetime) – comment creation date

  • updated_at (datetime) – datetime: comment update date

class src.database.models.Photo(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Class which describes table in database of the Photo

Parameters:

  • id (int) – photo unique id in DB

  • user_id (int) – id number of the user who entered the image into the DB

  • url (str) – url adress to the photo

  • description (str) – description of the photo

  • tags (relations) – tags about the photo which is putting in DB. Relation ‘many to many’ - many tags to one photo and one tag to many photos.

  • created_at (datetime) – the date and time of the photo creation - format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS where Y-means year, M - means month, D- means day H - means hour, M - means minutes and S - means seconds

  • updated_at (datetime) – the date and time of the photo updating - format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS where Y-means year, M - means month, D- means day H - means hour, M - means minutes and S - means seconds

  • rating (float) – rating

class src.database.models.User(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Class which describes table in database of the User

Parameters:

  • id (int) – User unique id in DB

  • username (str:) – Username

  • email (str:) – mail address of the user

  • password (str:) – user password

  • role (str:) – user role: admin, moderator or standard user

  • created_at (datetime:) – the date of user creation

  • avatar (str:) – link to the image of avatar in Cloudinary

  • refresh_token (str:) – refresh_token of the user

  • confirmed (boolean:) – information if the user is confirmed by mail

fastapi_app src repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(db: Session, comment: CommentCreate, user_id: int, photo_id: int)¶

Create a new comment and add it to the database.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • comment (schemas.CommentCreate) – The comment data to create.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user creating the comment.

  • photo_id (int) – The ID of the photo being commented on.

Returns:

The created comment.

Return type:

models.Comment

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(db: Session, comment_id: int)¶

Delete a comment from the database by its ID.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • comment_id (int) – The ID of the comment to delete.

Returns:

The deleted comment, or None if not found.

Return type:

models.Comment

async src.repository.comments.get_comment(db: Session, comment_id: int)¶

Retrieve a comment from the database by its ID.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • comment_id (int) – The ID of the comment to retrieve.

Returns:

The comment with the specified ID, or None if not found.

Return type:

models.Comment

  • comment (schemas.CommentUpdate) – The updated comment data.

  • comment_id (int) – The ID of the comment to update.

Returns:

The updated comment, or None if not found.

fastapi_app src repository Search_filter¶

async src.repository.search_filter.get_description(db: Session, description: str, rating_filter: int = None, created_at: str = None)¶

Retrieve one or more photos from the database based on their descriptions.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • description (str) – The description to search for (case-insensitive).

  • rating_filter – The rating of search photo.

  • created_at (str) – The date of search photo creation.

Type:

int

Returns:

A list of Photo objects matching the specified description or photo objects with its rating or its creation date. .

Return type:

List[models.Photo]

Raises:

HTTPException – If the photo is not found, or the photo with selected rating or creation date is not found, raises a 404 error with the detail message.

async src.repository.search_filter.get_tag(db: Session, tagname: str, rating_filter: int = None, created_at: str = None)¶

Retrieve one or more photos from the database based on their tag.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • tagname (str) – The tag to search for.

  • rating_filter – The rating of search photo.

  • created_at (str) – The date of search photo creation.

Type:

int

Returns:

A list of Photo objects matching the specified tagname.

Return type:

List[models.Photo]

Raises:

HTTPException – If the photo is not found, or the photo with selected rating or creation date is not found, raises a 404 error with the detail message.

fastapi_app src repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.ban_user(username: str, current_user: User, db: Session)¶

Ban a user from the system.

This function bans a user by deleting their record from the database. Only users with the ‘admin’ role are allowed to perform this action.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the user to be banned.

  • current_user (User) – The user performing the ban action.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The banned user object if the operation was successful, otherwise None.

Return type:

User or None

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to be confirmed.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user registration details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs while fetching the Gravatar image.

async src.repository.users.get_current_user_profile(user: User, db: Session)¶

Retrieve the current user’s profile information.

This function fetches the profile information of the current authenticated user, including the number of photos they have uploaded.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the user’s profile information.

Return type:

dict

async src.repository.users.get_profile(username: str, db: Session)¶

Retrieve the profile information for a given username.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the user whose profile is to be retrieved.

  • db (Session) – The database session used to query the user information.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the user’s profile information or None if the user does not exist.

Return type:

dict or None

async src.repository.users.update_user_profile(username: str, body: ProfileStatusUpdate, current_user: User, db: Session)¶

Update a user’s profile.

This function allows the current user to update their profile information if the username matches.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the user whose profile is being updated.

  • body (ProfileStatusUpdate) – The profile status update data.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The updated user profile or None if the username does not match the current user.

Return type:

User or None

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticates a user and returns JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found, email is not confirmed, or password is invalid.

Refreshes the JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for asynchronous operations.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user and a confirmation message.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user already exists.

Create a new photo.

  • tags (Optional[str]) – Space-separated tags for the photo.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

The saved photo object.

Return type:

Photo

Raises:

fastapi_app src services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async check_role(current_user: User, required_role: str)¶

Checks if the current user has the required role to perform an operation.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

  • required_role (str) – The role required to perform the operation.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not have the required role.

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generates a JWT access token with a specified expiration time (in seconds).

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The duration (in seconds) for which the token is valid.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generates a JWT refresh token with a specified expiration time (in seconds).

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The duration (in seconds) for which the token is valid.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Decodes the provided JWT refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email associated with the decoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the scope is incorrect.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Returns the current user associated with the provided JWT token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token for which to retrieve the user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session to use.

Returns:

The user associated with the provided token.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid, the scope is incorrect, or the user cannot be found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Decodes the provided JWT email verification token and returns the associated email.

Parameters:

token (str) – The token to decode.

Returns:

The email associated with the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Generates a hash for a plain password using the bcrypt algorithm.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

Compares a plain password with a hashed password to check if they match.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

async src.services.storage.save_photo(file: UploadFile) → str¶

Save an uploaded photo to the server.

This function saves an uploaded photo file to a specified directory on the server. The file is saved with a unique name generated using UUID to avoid conflicts.

Parameters:

file (UploadFile) – The uploaded file to be saved.

Returns:

The path to the saved file.

Return type:

str
